Erectile Dysfunction

Unfortunately, many men are reluctant to report erectile dysfunction (ED) to their partner, or physician, due to social stigmas associated with bedroom performance. ED, or the inability to maintain an erection, is much more common than the general population may realize and has a lot to do with men’s health. A Johns Hopkins study revealed that over 18 million men in the U.S. over the age of 20 experience difficulties having and maintaining an erection.

Your patients are experiencing this embarrassing condition, the most common causes being poor circulation, hormonal imbalances, obesity, metabolic syndrome, hypertension, diabetes, and lack of physical activity.

Blueprint to Practice Automation™ has brought together the exact resources to solve this puzzle for men across the country, and it can be treated from the comfort of their own home.  With the home shock wave ED device and fully automated virtual lifestyle protocols, men across the US are finally getting their sex life back. Through automated systems and online/at-home protocols, doctors finally have a scalable model without the headache of in-clinic visits, embarrassed patients, and uncomfortable staff duties.

The antiquated ED model of coming in the office multiple times only puts a strain on your staff, your time, your energy, your schedule, and the patient. 

By using our home model and practice automation strategies you will be able to combine ED with other niches when presented like neuropathy, knee pain, gut health, weight loss, keto, and more. This will allow you to offer better clinical programs, collect more money, all while working less.

Our practice automation model will provide the patient with the ability to treat themselves through education, supplementation, and have the ability for follow-up from your office all in the privacy of their home. This will take the stress and strain off of your patient, your time, your energy, your schedule and your practice. 

Just think you could have an automated system that allows you to manage your patient by providing a step-by-step protocol to help with their fibromyalgia, which in turn will help you increase your case fees, and provide a system and solution for your staff to provide care for these patients in office and online with our HIPPA compliant patient management software.

Be the answer in your community for fibromyalgia.

[/oxy_rich_text][/ct_div_block_4][/ct_div_block_3][/ct_div_block_2][/ct_section]
